abstract: Bits: Amazon and Macmillan talks continue, with most Macmillan titles still absent from Amazon’s Web site.
snippet: Bits: Amazon and Macmillan talks continue, with most Macmillan titles still absent from Amazon’s Web site.
lead_paragraph: On Sunday, Amazon appeared to surrender to Macmillan in a dispute over the pricing of e-books. Macmillan, like other publishers, wanted more control over prices for their digital books. At first, Amazon responded by removing Macmillan titles, both digital and paper, from its site, except when bought through third-party vendors. Then, Amazon seemed to back down. But the talks are continuing, and Macmillan titles are still mostly absent from the Amazon site. Read the full story here.

headline.main: Bits: Macmillan Books Still Largely Absent on Amazon
